page.title: 07HOUSING IN AYLESBURY
page.content: Aylesbury has a variety of house styles from seventeenth century {brick and timber} houses in the town centre { Victorian} terraces and modern estates of brick built houses. Current trends in housing are towards smaller houses with small gardens. This is in response to land prices which have increased 1,000% since 1978. Expensive houses are built at a density of 2-4 houses to an acre, whilst estates have a density of 10 or more houses to an acre.{Counci}l housing has shown a rapid decline in recent years. Aylesbury is an {expanding} town, in 1981 the population was 50,000 and is expected to rise to 60,000 in 1991. This has resulted in the building of housing estates on the edges of the town.
